nodes.text: Farah? Farah, I need a status report! [static] What's your condition up there?
nodes.comment: Fade In, GC_363_DEAD_IN_SPACE, set viewscreen Kamea

nodes.text: The Argo's main drive is still off-line! I'm working on it in Engineering… I think I've got the malicious code isolated, but it's already done a lot of damage. [static] What's your status, Lady Arano?

We're on the move! [[DM.Factions[faction_TaurianConcordat],Taurian]] marines have taken the [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreOutpostCastle],Outpost Castle]]—most of our salvage team is dead. Yang's sealed the Mech Bay doors, but they won't hold for long. There are only five of us left: me, Yang, and three of the MechWarriors from the Delfinas. [static] We're on our way to the surface in the few 'Mechs that Yang managed to get running.
Heads up, Lady Arano—when you reach the surface, you're gonna have company. I'm picking up a Taurian recon lance standing just outside the main doors.

Acknowledged, Ms. Meyer. The recon lance doesn't worry me.

When they see what we're piloting, they'll wish they'd stayed home.

branches.responseText: I'm just glad that you and Yang are still alive. Is he holding up okay?
Good job getting those 'Mechs running, Yang. Drinks are on me when you get home.
Those recon 'Mechs are just the first wave. We're in trouble, people.

nodes.text: I'm riding through a frozen hellscape in a pressure cooker on legs, getting shot at by ancient robots and a bunch of damned Taurians. [static] I've had better days. Look, can anybody tell me why the Taurians are fighting for Espinosa? And what this Ostergaard guy has against us, specifically? [static] 'Cause this is some grade-A bullshit right here.

branches.responseText: <color=#85DBF6FF>[Ancestry: Deep Periphery]</color> I dunno, Yang. Out where my ancestors came from in the Deep Periphery, we didn't have these problems.
<color=#85DBF6FF>[Ancestry: Magistracy of Canopus]</color> I've long since given up trying to understand why the Taurians do anything.
<color=#85DBF6FF>[Ancestry: Federated Suns]</color> I've long since given up trying to understand why the Taurians do anything.
<color=#85DBF6FF>[Ancestry: Taurian Concordat]</color> You're telling me, Yang. Going to war against my own people isn't high on my priority list.
They were waiting for us in this system. Somebody must've told them we were coming.
branches.comment: BG: Not Taurian, Not Magistracy, Not Davion, Not DeepPer

branches.responseText: The Directorate must've found out about Nautilus somehow and offered it to them.
Beats the hell out of me, Yang. We'll figure it out as we go along.

nodes.text: Yeah, well, if you go back someday, make sure to take me along with you. [static] 'Cause right now, that sounds like a really nice change of pace.

My people shouldn't be fighting us, damn it. They shouldn't even be here at all. Aside from us and Karosas, nobody should know anything about Castle Nautilus. So how the hell did they know to where to find us?

Best guess? The Taurians were tipped off by Espinosa—and that means we've got ourselves a mole. I'll bet you anything I know who it is, too. Otto Karosas. Remember what Lord Karosas told us—his son returned from Weldry a different person. The Directorate played with his mind and broke him somehow.

They shouldn't be fighting us, damn it. They shouldn't even be here at all. Aside from us and Karosas, nobody should know anything about Castle Nautilus. So how the hell did they know to find us here?

Yeah, mine either. But honestly, I'm more concerned with how they knew to find us here at all. This Commodore shouldn't know anything about our movements or the Outpost Castle. Aside from us and Karosas, nobody should. So how the hell did they know to find us here?
But who, though? Espinosa? He shouldn't know anything about our movements, or the Outpost Castle! Aside from us and Karosas, nobody should! How the hell did they know to find us here?
How? Espinosa shouldn't know anything about our movements, or the Outpost Castle! Aside from us and Karosas, nobody should! How the hell did they know to find us here?

Best guess? We've got ourselves a mole. And the smart money says it's Otto Karosas. Remember what Lord Karosas told us—his son returned from Weldry a different person. The Directorate played with his mind and broke him somehow.

Whatever the reason, I bet I can tell you how they knew where to look for us. The Taurians were tipped off by Espinosa—and that means we've got ourselves a mole. Specifically, Otto Karosas. Remember what Lord Karosas told us—his son returned from Weldry a different person. The Directorate played with his mind and broke him somehow.

You think they [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreBrainwashing],brainwashed]] him. It's plausible. I'll send warning to Smithon as soon as I'm able, but right now, the only things that matter are fixing this ship and getting Kamea away from the Taurian border. The Restoration dies if she's captured.

branches.responseText: <color=#85DBF6FF>[Background: Merchant Guard]</color> I've been protecting people my entire life, Alexander. I sure as hell don't intend to stop now.
Don't worry, Lord Madeira. We'll have Sumire pick them up directly.
He's right. We need to focus on the job at hand.

nodes.text:
Thank you, Commander.

Please, just… bring her home.
Hate to be the bearer of bad news, but the Argo's docking clamps are locked tight. Damned things won't budge. Until Farah fixes whatever that thing did to the ship, the Leopard is out of commission.
I'm working on it! If I can get the doors to Engineering open, we can manually release the clamps.

branches.responseText: Let us know if we can do anything to help.
Clear the line, Doc. Focus on your work, not on us!
You'd better, Doc. Your little fishing expedition in the Nautilus Memory Core may well have cost us the ship.

nodes.text: Will do! [static] Please, Lady Arano… keep yourself alive. I'll fix this—I promise!
Aye, Commander, clearing the line! And Lady Arano, please… keep yourself alive. I'll fix this, I promise!
I know, Commander! I know. And yes, all of this is on me—I am painfully aware of that fact. Lady Arano, I just need you to keep yourselves alive. Give me some time and I'll fix this, I promise!

[static] Roger that, Farah—we'll hold out for as long as we can.

This elevator is accelerating—we're almost at the surface. Any second now these doors are going to open, and we'll need someplace to go. Darius, what are our options?

Best bet? The Delfinas. Lord Karosas's other support ships have either fled or been destroyed, but the Delfinas is still on the planet's surface, and she's within sprinting distance of the Castle gates. She's currently powered down... I don't think the Taurians have detected her yet. If you can make it out there, Captain Grigas and his crew should be able to extract you.
That's the plan, then. Dr. Murad will have until we get there to fix the Argo—any longer and we're all dead. [static] {COMMANDER.Callsign}, I need you to stay on the comms and guide us through this.

branches.responseText: I'll see you through safely, Lady Arano. You have my word.
That's what you're paying me for.
Just so long as you do what I say. No ego and no second-guessing—just do it.

nodes.text:
The elevator's just come to a stop. Lights in here are flashing—any second, the doors are going to slide open.

MechWarriors! Ready yourselves for action!

If we don't get them off of that planet, we're gonna lose our Chief MechTech and our most important client. That can't be allowed to happen.

You've got this, {COMMANDER.FirstName}. Guide our people home.

I'll take you up on that, Boss… I'm gonna need it. [static] Believe it or not, I've had better days. Hey, can anybody tell me why the Taurians are fighting for Espinosa? And what this Ostergaard guy has against us, specifically? [static] 'Cause this is some grade-A bullshit right here.

Yeah, Boss... I'd figured that much out on my own. [static] Man, what a day. Look, can anybody tell me why the Taurians are fighting for Espinosa? And what this Ostergaard guy has against us, specifically? [static] 'Cause this is some grade-A bullshit right here.
